event.title: was abandoned after the Dakota-U.S. War of 1862

data.event: In 1861, there was an attempt to build one on Mill Creek, at the outlet of the Great Lakes but the attempt was abandoned after the Dakota-U.S. War of 1862 and the extremely low water level that year.
In 1868 one was successfully built, and sawmill was built and put into operation in 1869.

event.title: was built and put into operation in 1869

data.event: In 1868 one was successfully built, and sawmill was built and put into operation in 1869.
In 1870, the company that operated the mill bought a section of land northwest of Old Town and laid out a plan for the town of Milford.
